trueon_bothfalse8969853f6fabf500250e6bbeae3ee4c601970-01-03 00:00:00Instructions: Complete the fields below and submit your travel request. Prior to final authorization, the request will go through several sets of approvals, including your supervisor, branch chief, and NIH/NCI. Please refer to the CBIIT Travel Hub for all information on the CBIIT Travel and Registration Request Process, additional guidance, and points of contact.

Note: All costs included in this form are estimates. Actual costs and amounts for reimbursement will be determined upon submission and approval of travel vouchers upon your return.

sys_update_xml.name: sysevent_in_email_action_3f5aaf446ffde200bbc002e6eb3ee449
sys_update_xml.payload: record_actiontrueThis inbound email action is triggered when an email is sent to ServiceNow and: 1. The email is a reply. 2. The email being replied to was sent by ServiceNow due to creation or update of an Approval Request. This inbound email action can update the state field of an Approval Request, if the subject of the email contains either "approve" or "reject", or if the state is set within the body of the email. In addition to being able to explicitly set the value of the state field, the whole email is added to the Approval Request as a comment. Example reply email: this reply will update comments for the Approval Request with "This seems fine.", and set the state to "approved". ----- From: Fred Luddy <fred.luddy@example.com> Subject: Re: Approval request has been assigned to you Date: June 11, 2013 3:10:54 PM PDT To: ServiceNow This seems fine. state: approved On Jun 11, 2013, at 3:08 PM, IT Service Desk wrote: Ref:MSG0000107 ----- email.readUpdate CTPS Task_NCI150falsesysevent_in_email_actionwuye@nih.gov2016-09-07 02:45:25trueglobal3f5aaf446ffde200bbc002e6eb3ee4499Update CTPS Task_NCIglobalfalseglobalsysevent_in_email_action_3f5aaf446ffde200bbc002e6eb3ee449wuye@nih.gov2016-09-07 14:09:10sc_task

sys_update_xml.payload:
sc_taskHello,

This notification is to inform you that Task ${number} has been assigned to you by ${sys_updated_by}.
Click here to view Task: ${URI_REF}

The details of this task are as follows:

Requested for: ${request.requested_for}
Location: ${request.requested_for.location}
Room: ${request.requested_for.u_room}
Phone: ${request.requested_for.phone}
Email: ${request.requested_for.email}

Request: ${request}
Request item: ${request_item}
Item: ${request_item.cat_item}
${mail_script:task_requested_item_short_description}

Short Description: ${short_description}
Description: ${description}
Work notes: ${work_notes}
